result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel P Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:33 PM - Def in court w/Atty Thomas Yoon Huh.  Edward Minser appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Ct. 3 - possess amphetamine - Guilty
Ct. 4 - possess para - Guilty
Ct. 5 - possess THC - Guilty
remaining charges dismissed and read in
SNP filed/signed/understands
  Plea Quest filed/signed/understands
Understands const rights waived
Understands elements of crime
No promises/threats
No alc/drugs  in the last 24 hrs
  Plea is F, V & I made. Sufficient factual basis to support the plea and the def is found guilty.
MINSER: He was found w/ a variety of substances. He has lengthly crim hx including 13 prior CM convictions. Recommend probation. HUH: He immediately took steps to address his sub abuse issues. He's enrolled in trmt. He's been bond compliant for the past 4 mos since this case has been open. DEF: I go weekly to AODA counselor and take urine tests and I plan on continuing that. CRT: you have really stepped up and got involved in trmt. 
SENTENCE: 
Sentence withheld -  12 mos probation
Cond: con't w/ the existing trmt plan; no use or possession of con't subs w/o Rx; random testingl 50 hrs com service; follow thru w/ the plan to get your HSED. Pay DOC fees & CC. 1 day credit

2:51 AM - Def in court w/Atty Thomas Yoon Huh.  Emily Hynek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Huh: you con't this today from last wk as he was to provide trmt progress from Cadot Med Cnt. I  contacted them and they thought they sent it but I checked w/ my office and we didn't get it. It will be a mis plea w/ probation and we would ask the court for something else. He goes back on Monday and can get it then. 
PLEA/SENT: Andrea to set next wk after Monday

Def in court w/Atty Thomas Yoon Huh.  Justine L. Suleski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Huh: report not ready until Monday and it will be a mis plea

Huh: he didn't get notice. It will be a mis plea. He has started his AODA in BRF. Need a couple weeks
